Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2016 12:09PM flipflop wrote: I experienced the milk let down feeling. It's when your milk is in and it comes down the pipes to your baby there's this feeling like a tingly almost burning feeling right before it starts to come out. That's the milk let down.

Posts.Title: titanium markers tas1937 flipflop

Posts.Content: Feb 29, 2016 06:34PM - edited Feb 29, 2016 06:35PM by flipflop I would start with asking for an ultrasound and if possible time reserved for biopsy if they do find something (save you a trip back - not sure it's an option everywhere but mine was scheduled that way so I was able to have them done all at once) They also did a mammogram right after but only because they found something suspicious. It was kind of moot since the US showed more than the mammogram and they knew pretty much right away mine was cancer. An MRI followed the same week. But again they knew cancer. So I would definitely ask for an ultrasound first and if possible biopsy (ifsomething is found) at the same time. Good luck
Posts.Title: Found an indention andralynaa andralynaa

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2016 05:44PM flipflop wrote: well I don't ever want to frighten anyone but I had the let down feeling. But I didn't have size reduction (mine got bigger) or indentations. I did have an inverted nipple and beige/sometimes blood tinged discharge. I had no pain per se just discomfort from the swelling.
Posts.Title: Concerned and scared about chances in breast Satamicca Satamicca

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2016 07:13PM - edited Mar 10, 2016 07:14PM by flipflop ^^^ those ladies all said it best. You'll get to a point where you wipe off those tears, stand up, and say "FU cancer. You're going down." And you will likely cry more. And then wipe those away, too. It gets easier but I agree with the poster who said it takes time to adjust to your new normal. That's a perfect way to say it. Because it's very true. I have two small kids so I get that too but they push me to keep fighting. I played this song when I would get down and it helped pick me back up:
